h2.a: How We're Protecting Our Students from COVID-19

div.p: This letter is to update you as we continue to closely monitor and follow the State Education and Health Department guidelines. In response to coronavirus COVID-19. EMHCS is working with local and state department of health to develop action steps as the COVID-19 has become a pandemic. Governor Cuomo has declared a State of Emergency related to the growing number of COVID-19 cases statewide.
Join a school where we help children believe, achieve and succeed.
Send your resume and cover letter to careers@emhcharter.org

h1.a: Coronavirus Closing & Resources for Home Learning

div.p: All campuses are now closed until further notice. You can see all resources, news and more here.
Please consider emailing your child’s teacher with any academic questions you may have. You can look them up at emhcharter.org/school-directory. We will continue to post the latest news here.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_14 et_clickable et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light

div.h5: Click here to see more positive student stories.

div.h2: We are proud to be EMHCS!

div.p: Eugenio María de Hostos Charter School now celebrating its 20th year of being an educational institution of excellence in our community. Our school provides new and innovative ways of learning. Each student is unique and therefore our teachers understand that the learning style of each child may differ, and our staff is equipped to help nourish those learning styles. We are extremely proud of the talented pool of employees that we have serving our students. Our ultimate goal is to ensure that our students receive the best possible education, if a student is unable to learn the way we teach, then we will learn to teach the way the child can learn. Our ultimate goal is to ensure that every child has a quality education regardless of socioeconomic levels. We appreciate the sense of family that has been fostered throughout the years and the commitment that you have in your child’s education.
